poem:
Still Morning

The light spills in, warm,
caressing the cradle
of our tired bodies.

Last night's passions —
a whispering ember,
now resting.

The coffee cools
while we linger,
our silence
the poem unfolding.

No more the darkness
to hide us,
only this honest
daybreak kiss,
reflecting.
